subject: Productivity
title: Egyptian Pyramid Logistics
description: A short lesson to help you apply Egyptian Pyramid Logistics.

hook.text: The Great Pyramid used 2.3 million stone blocks. Organizing that workforce was a productivity miracle.

buildup.text: Thousands of workers were fed, housed, and coordinated across decades using papyrus records.

discovery.text: Archaeologists found worker villages with bakeries, breweries, and medical care. It was planned labor, not slavery.

twist.text: The real achievement wasn't the stones. It was the management system that moved them.

climax.text: Ancient Egypt proves that productivity systems are as old as civilization itself.

punchline.text: Pyramids were built on logistics, not just labor.

quiz.question: What did archaeologists discover about pyramid workers?
options: They had planned villages with food, housing, and medical care
They worked without any management system
